> It would be nice. I just don't see any way to do it without making JUnit 
> tremendously stinky and ugly and dangerous. :(

Executing a private method has *nothing* to do with how you run the 
tests.  Since JUnit is running tests, the solution is not in changing 
the core application but in writing a new TestCase that will allow you 
to access private methods/fields.

-Vladimir
